<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For ARMv8-M, we /do/ implement tail calls.  Doing this is tricky for v8-M</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// baseline, since the LDM/POP instruction on Thumb doesn&#39;t take LR.  This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// means if we need to reload LR, it takes extra instructions, which outweighs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the value of the tail call; but here we don&#39;t know yet whether LR is going</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to be used. We take the optimistic approach of generating the tail call and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// perhaps taking a hit if we need to restore the LR.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Thumb1 PIC calls to external symbols use BX, so they can be tail calls,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// but we need to make sure there are enough registers; the only valid</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// case.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="449" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#a20228b431bb0e2852055ea7815a46743"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#a20228b431bb0e2852055ea7815a46743">ARMSubtarget::getGPRAllocationOrder</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp;MF)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The GPR register class has multiple possible allocation orders, with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// tradeoffs preferred by different sub-architectures and optimisation goals.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="452"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The allocation orders are:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 0: (the default tablegen order, not used)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1: r14, r0-r13</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2: r0-r7</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 3: r0-r7, r12, lr, r8-r11</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note that the register allocator will change this order so that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="458"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// callee-saved registers are used later, as they require extra work in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// prologue/epilogue (though we sometimes override that).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="460"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="461"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For thumb1-only targets, only the low registers are allocatable.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="462"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#a2dc8447e2cf1376dbeebf919c0cddc9a">isThumb1Only</a>())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="463"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> 2;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="464"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="465"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Allocate low registers first, so we can select more 16-bit instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="466"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We also (in ignoreCSRForAllocationOrder) override  the default behaviour</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="467"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with regards to callee-saved registers, because pushing extra registers is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="468"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// much cheaper (in terms of code size) than using high registers. After</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="469"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that, we allocate r12 (doesn&#39;t need to be saved), lr (saving it means we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="470"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// can return with the pop, don&#39;t need an extra &quot;bx lr&quot;) and then the rest of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="471"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the high registers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="472"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#a366b7fda111b63c2bf86c1b81a9cc362">isThumb2</a>() &amp;&amp; MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a977ddce262de45c645be23d951066351">getFunction</a>().<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function/#a548cfb9440f36ba67fc5566b8e967fc6">hasMinSize</a>())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="473"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> 3;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="474"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="475"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Otherwise, allocate in the default order, using LR first because saving it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="476"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// allows a shorter epilogue sequence.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="477"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> 1;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="478"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="479"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#a6a5ef234051f5fe582e5fa53d655d3d9"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#a6a5ef234051f5fe582e5fa53d655d3d9">ARMSubtarget::ignoreCSRForAllocationOrder</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp;MF,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                               <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcregister">MCRegister</a> PhysReg)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="482"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// To minimize code size in Thumb2, we prefer the usage of low regs (lower</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="483"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// cost per use) so we can  use narrow encoding. By default, caller-saved</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="484"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// registers (e.g. lr, r12) are always  allocated first, regardless of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// their cost per use. When optForMinSize, we prefer the low regs even if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// they are CSR because usually push/pop can be folded into existing ones.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="487"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#a366b7fda111b63c2bf86c1b81a9cc362">isThumb2</a>() &amp;&amp; MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a977ddce262de45c645be23d951066351">getFunction</a>().<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function/#a548cfb9440f36ba67fc5566b8e967fc6">hasMinSize</a>() &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="488"><span class="doxyHighlight">         ARM::GPRRegClass.contains(PhysReg);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#ab3f7c70dd539567001e35caea74ade4b">ARMSubtarget::PushPopSplitVariation</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#aada6bb4af36a2736480f0c51fced2d58"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#aada6bb4af36a2736480f0c51fced2d58">ARMSubtarget::getPushPopSplitVariation</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp;MF)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a> = MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a977ddce262de45c645be23d951066351">getFunction</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo">MachineFrameInfo</a> &amp;MFI = MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a54f334a9c8ca6d105eae383ae87e4524">getFrameInfo</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::vector&lt;CalleeSavedInfo&gt; CSI =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><span class="doxyHighlight">      MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a54f334a9c8ca6d105eae383ae87e4524">getFrameInfo</a>().<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#aad474502cac7b22b83e74de089f8c81d">getCalleeSavedInfo</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Thumb1 always splits the pushes at R7, because the Thumb1 push instruction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// cannot use high registers except for lr.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#a2dc8447e2cf1376dbeebf919c0cddc9a">isThumb1Only</a>())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#ab3f7c70dd539567001e35caea74ade4ba5ba862e3a9b6eca2a66b539bd990761c">SplitR7</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If R7 is the frame pointer, we must split at R7 to ensure that the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// previous frame pointer (R7) and return address (LR) are adjacent on the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// stack, to form a valid frame record.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="506"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#a3d0de6c30c8e5b1342e3f238e765221c">getFramePointerReg</a>() == ARM::R7 &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="507"><span class="doxyHighlight">      MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#af777ff93c9e07a6ff5ffe3226deb3e76">getTarget</a>().<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetmachine/#ab1fb67187fc37e569cc5171cbebba873">Options</a>.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetoptions/#aa56ae8efa388a7840c07b61e6a03b33e">FramePointerIsReserved</a>(MF))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#ab3f7c70dd539567001e35caea74ade4ba5ba862e3a9b6eca2a66b539bd990761c">SplitR7</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Returns SplitR11WindowsSEH when the stack pointer needs to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// restored from the frame pointer r11 + an offset and Windows CFI is enabled.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This stack unwinding cannot be expressed with SEH unwind opcodes when done</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with a single push, making it necessary to split the push into r4-r10, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// another containing r11+lr.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#af777ff93c9e07a6ff5ffe3226deb3e76">getTarget</a>().<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetmachine/#afb72c5626afbc815284e2b26bb0663f8">getMCAsmInfo</a>()-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcasminfo/#ac158349781823fe8ff9e02d3a3533d55">usesWindowsCFI</a>() &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#ab3f7c70dd539567001e35caea74ade4ba2fba6120097ea9615c4a13a82fe8042d">SplitR11WindowsSEH</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Returns SplitR11AAPCSSignRA when the frame pointer is R11, requiring R11</span></CodeLine>
